alongstory_short: I get all in my head whenever i have to describe myself in words, now that I’ve realized how much better I am doing it with my body and actions. maggybearlovesyou: Hi Ericka!!!!! We go by many names, MJ, Magma Jane, Maggie Jane, Magic Jane, Nijay... whatever’s clever! We are white, currently exploring and unraveling and working to dismantle at rapid rates the White Supremacy Culture and violence that lives within me and around me. We identify as gender expansive and non-binary and prefer to be called they/them pronouns. We also often refer to ourselves as we as well as I! And we’re just at the beginning of our journey of gender expansion and white supremacy culture dismantling. I am truly so grateful to have connected with you here and to learn from your sharing and educating. Thank you. Thank you thank you thank you 🙏🏼 we live in Portland Oregon. Life has been shifting in major ways for us and I keep asking to Spirit to show me the way to use my privileges to be of service to the highest good of all people, particularly and especially those most marginalized by white supremacy culture and colonization and heteronormativity. You inspired us last night to explore Columbia’s MSW program. I called the admission office today and spoke with a person named Todd at length and I felt heard and appreciated and welcomed in my sharing and queries of this systemic dismantling. I am so grateful for the privilege of looking into planning a trip to come to Columbia for an info session on December 3 (as well as visit grandma in MA) and truly, your existence and beingness and radical justice enacting have inspired us to use all of our privileges and powers to be of service to those who are most marginalized by the systems of oppression under White Supremacy Culture that I have and still do benefit from. I am truly so beyond words grateful that we have connected with you here. 💛🙏🏼🌈 thank you, Ericka. 💛🌈🦋✊🏼
